results.title: The Crown of Thorns Story
results.creator_credit: Educational Information Service Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority and L Zann
results.brief_description: This video presents the most up to date report on the Crown of Thorns available in Australia today. The documentary tells the story of the Crown of Thorns on the Great barrier Reef. It traces the history of the infestations and what is now known about the starfish with special emphasis on the research currently underway.

results.title: The Crow road
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Union Pictures Productions, Bradley Adams and Calvin Miller
results.brief_description: Rory McHoan was last seen on his way to visit his brother, Kenneth, seven years ago. No trace of him was ever found despite an exhaustive police investigation. Inspired by his grandmother, Rory’s nephew, Prentice, takes on the task of finding Rory, and uncovering the truth about his missing uncle’s disappearance. With only Rory’s archaic and unreadable computer disks, pages of a novel-in-progress, and a ghost at his shoulders, Prentice must make a long journey with discoveries to be made about himself before he can unravel the dark secrets that lie buried in his family’s history. Based on a novel by Iain Banks. Cast includes: Joseph McFadden, Bill Paterson and Valerie Edmond.

results.title: The Crow
results.creator_credit: Crowvision, Edward Pressman, Jeff Most and Alex Proyas
results.brief_description: There is a legend that when a soul can’t rest, a crow can bring that soul back form the dead, to seek justice and make the wrongs thins right.. In the film which cost him his life, martial arts phenomenon Brandon Lee stars as a superhuman mystical hero who returns from the grave to exact revenge on the killers of his fiancee and himself. The film contains fantastic special effects, awesome action and a dark, cyberpunk setting. Lee was killed on the set accidentally in a manner similar to his father, martial arts legend Bruce Lee, so a stand-in was used to complete the filming.

results.title: The Cross road crash
results.creator_credit: Telemark Productions, Film Australia and Commonwealth Department of Transport
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Indicates that crossroads are one of the most likely places to have a collision. Lists the type of crossroads and discusses the avoidance of situations leading to accidents. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Critic
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Ernest Pintoff
results.brief_description: With voice-over commentary by Mel Brooks as an aging cinema patron, this animated film is a satire on audiences as well as on the offerings in present day theatres and art galleries. The film ridicules both ‘art’ that is really a hoax, and people who mistake ignorance for wit and wisdom.

results.title: The Crisis = La Crise
results.creator_credit: Les Films Alain Sarde, TFI Films, Alain Sarde and Coline Serreau
results.brief_description: A heartfelt French comedy whose warmth and humour is matched equally by its biting and poignant commentary on social, political and racial issues in France in the early 1990s. Victor (Vincent Lindon), a smart and successful lawyer, is deserted by his wife and fired on the same day. He turns to his colleagues, his friends, his family, but all have troubled and complex lives and have no time to deal with his as well. Enter Michou (Patrick Timsit), a wandering barfly who attaches himself to Victor, both comedic and wise in the effect he has on the lives he touches and most of all on Victor and on the journey through which his sudden crisis takes him. Through their interaction with each other and those around them, brief or lasting, and the humorous antics that befall the unlikely pair, Serreau constructs a striking fairy tale with a subtle political, social and racial critique that confronts the dual existence of humanity and hypocrisy in its many forms in contemporary society. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Crime of Mr Lange = Le Crime de Monsieur Lange
results.creator_credit: Oberon, Andre Halley des Fontaines and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Lange is an author of wild west novels. When the owner of the company that publishes Lange’s works absconds with the company funds, Lange rallies the employees together to create their own publishing house. The publisher returns, disguised as a priest, and demands a share of the profits. Lange responds by killing him. The grateful employees help Lange to escape prosecution, allowing him to leave the country with his lovely fiancee. It is a joyous film, just as the Popular Front was a joyous movement, happy in the belief that living and working conditions could be changed for the better and fascism resisted at home and abroad. Exploitation (including sexual exploitation) are represented as the product of authoritarian capitalism, represented here by the publisher. Cast includes Rene Lefevre, Jules Berry, Florelle and Nadia Sibirkskaia. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Cricket on the hearth
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Charles Dickins this is a tale of love and misfortune with an American slant. Cast includes Owen Moore, Linda Arvidson, David Miles, Violet Mersereau, Dorothy West, mack Sennett, Harry Solter. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Crescent wing
results.brief_description: The problems of wing-design in high-speed long-range aeroplanes. With the aid of diagrams and smoke-tunnel photography the film explains in basic terms the relative advantages and disadvantages of varying thickness and span of wings and degree of sweepback. The solution arrived at by the designers is the crescent-shaped win used in the Victor 4-engines jet bomber, which is shown in flight and landing.
